message: Great Citrus Bowl win by LSU today! Proud we dominated the country's #1 defense.
Happy New Year! In 2017 we're turning the page, and I'm looking forward to working with President Donald Trump to Make America Great Again!
Starting the new year off right! I'm helping Harrison put the finishing touches on his pinewood derby car!

This is the oath we take today, the first day of the 115th Congress: to support and defend the Constitution against all enemies; foreign and domestic.  It is my honor to serve you. I'm going to do everything I can to work with President Donald Trump to restore the Constitution and undo the abuses of government power that have happened under President Obama.
We have a message for President Obama: Health care decisions belong in the hands of patients and doctors - not bureaucrats. Ì†ºÌø•

Obama made very specific promises to the American people about Obamacare. Then millions of Americans lost the good healthcare plans that they liked and expected to keep, but are not able to, because of the broken promises of his law.

We're going to work hard EVERY DAY not just to repeal Obamacare, but to replace it with a system that put patients back in charge of their health care decisions, that focus on lowering costs and increasing access to health care and brings doctors back into the practice of medicine.

We took two important actions tonight to support our ally Israel and to stop Barack Obama from abusing his executive powers. I'm looking forward to a few weeks from now, when we'll have a President who cares about bringing jobs back to America and treats our allies with respect.
NA
Harrison had the big weigh-in of the "Trump Mobile" tonight before the pinewood derby tomorrow!

If you like your plan you can keep it, if you like your doctor you can keep your doctor, costs will be $2,500 lower.... Every one of those promises was broken by Barack Obama.   Obama should be apologizing for creating Obamacare.

Today is National Law Enforcement Appreciation Day. If you can take a moment, please pray for the recoveries of Sheriff's Deputy Nick Tullier and wildlife agent Tyler Wheeler.  Nick is still recovering from the attack in July last year against Baton Rouge police, and Tyler was shot Saturday during a traffic stop. The men and women in our law enforcement community take huge risks every day to keep our families safe.   They deserve all the support we can give them.
Thank you to all law enforcement officers - my office is lit blue in your honor!  #NationalLawEnforcementAppreciationDay

Obamacare is failing families all across the country. They elected us to provide relief. It's exciting that we're getting the opportunity, not just to repeal Obamacare, but start the process of replacing it with reforms that put patients back in charge.

For eight years, the Obama Administration has run wild creating a trillion dollars in regulations that crush innovation and send our jobs overseas.   I'm working hard to reverse the damage they've done. In just two weeks we've passed three HUGE bills to cut red tape, and we're just getting started!
Obamacare has failed the American people.
We just passed our budget that starts the process of repealing Obamacare!  #MAGA
Help is on the way for American families who are struggling with the burdens of Obamacare.
The American people gave us a unified Republican government, and I'm honored to have the opportunity to work for you so we can Make America Great Again.
Congress has already passed the first step to repeal Obamacare.
We've been counting down the days and watching the progress! Just 3 days to go until the inauguration of President-elect Donald Trump!

Our military troops, diplomats and intelligence officers risk their lives every day to keep our country safe and free. Manning betrayed them all by leaking thousands of classified documents, putting American lives at risk and our allies in danger. For President Obama to commute Manning‚Äôs sentence is an insult to the rule of law and is an added stain on his legacy of abused executive action.
We've seen slow growth, lost wages, unemployment and Washington trying to put its hands in every aspect of our lives. The good news is that changes TODAY.

Congratulations to our new President Donald Trump and Vice President Mike Pence! I'm looking forward to working with them to get Washington out of the way and unleash the opportunity and the potential of all Americans.

With the stroke of a pen, Obama destroyed 300,000 jobs and 10,000 small businesses by signing Obamacare into law. Since then we have seen premiums rise, choices decline, and people lost the plans they had and liked. Things are only getting worse.  The House, Senate, and President Trump have all taken steps to begin repealing Obamacare. Our replacement will increase choices, reduce costs, and put decisions back in your hands.

Our new President has hit the ground running! First he froze new regulations and started the process of giving Americans relief from Obamacare. Now he is working to improve our trade deals, stop taxpayer funding to promote or provide abortions overseas, and reduce government by freezing Federal hiring.

We should be creating jobs and investing - not filing archaic reports about competition in the telegraph industry! Washington wastes your time and money on outrageous bureaucratic paperwork, and I'm proud to report that today the House passed my bill to help cut through red tape.

Today marks the beginning of a new era in American energy policy. After eight years of an Obama White House that undermined American energy at every turn, our nation finally has a president who is focused on strengthening our energy security, growing our economy and creating American jobs.

A majority of Americans agree: not a single cent of taxpayer money should ever be spent to fund abortions. I'm proud to report that the House took action to PERMANENTLY ban any taxpayer funding for abortions.

We can ignore a problem, or we can fix it. President Trump is fixing it. It's that simple.  Right now our unsafe and insecure borders are putting our national security at risk,  and our immigration system is broken. The Obama Administration ignored these problems because it suited their political agenda. They left a terrible problem in our hands to fix, but we're going to do it because we believe in the rule of law.

I thanked our President today for the actions he has taken in his first week to stop taxpayer financing of foreign abortions and rejuvenate America's energy industry with projects like the Keystone XL pipeline.

To all the students from Louisiana participating in today's March for Life, thank you! Your passion and energy to defend innocent life has made the movement thrive. I believe good days are ahead with a Republican in the White House and a Supreme Court nomination on the horizon.

Under Obama, America's military strength and readiness declined. It's time for America to be strong again. Our allies should respect us, and our enemies should fear us.   President Trump had it right when he said "Our military strength will be questioned by no one, but neither will our dedication to peace."

People are tired of double digit premium increases and insurance they can't afford to use. We're going to provide Americans with relief - it's front and center on our agenda and we are moving forward to repeal and replace Obamacare.
Getting ready for Mardi Gras! We viewed the Hermes floats in New Orleans!
This is a great idea because 'more regulation' can't be Washington's solution to every problem. We can't afford it. Radical regulations already cost our economy trillions of dollars a year.

We're building huge momentum to get the economy moving again and rebuild the middle class.  ‚úÖ Freeze on new regulations  ‚úÖ Two House bills with major regulatory reform  ‚úÖ Requiring agencies to cut two regulations for every new one  ‚úÖ Congressional disapproval of job-killing red tape

Was proud to be at the White House tonight as President Trump selected Judge Neil Gorsuch to be his nominee for Supreme Court.  President Trump campaigned on a pledge to nominate justices who will uphold the Constitution, and his selection of Gorsuch delivers on that promise in a big way.  While we can never truly replace Justice Antonin Scalia‚Äîwho was one of the greatest legal minds in our nation‚Äôs history‚Äîin Neil Gorsuch, President Trump has chosen a principled conservative to fill this important vacancy.

A preacher should not have to get permission from the IRS to be able to preach to their congregation. And yet today, the threat of losing tax-exempt for using their first amendment rights hangs over our churches like a cloud.   Yesterday my colleagues and I introduced legislation to protect our churches from IRS censorship, and today I was very glad to hear President Donald Trump weigh in on the need to protect our churches' freedom of speech at the National Prayer Breakfast.

Thank you Larry Katz from Dots Diner for sharing your story - Obamacare has forced over 10,000 small businesses to shut down and almost 300,000 people have lost their jobs as a result.  Repealing Obamacare will give immediate relief to Louisiana's small businesses and entrepreneurs!

Judge Gorsuch is known for his fierce defense of the Constitution, and also for his integrity, honesty and fairness. He is exactly the right kind of Supreme Court Justice we need to protect the Constitution, preserve liberty and protect the unborn.

Every American should be able to speak freely about their conscience and convictions, no matter what their job is. And our churches should not live under a shadow of fear when voicing their beliefs.   That's why I joined my colleagues in an initiative to protect the First Amendment rights of churches and nonprofit organizations.

If you are in an area being affected by tornadoes, please stay vigilant and take shelter as directed. We are so grateful for our first responders and others who are hard at work to keep people informed and safe.

Obama gave more and more control to education bureaucrats in Washington at the expense of students back in our local communities. Some of these regulations would jeopardize special education programs and schools in low-income neighborhoods.   The House took action to restore local control of our schools.
A 103-year-old Pearl Harbor veteran had an unexpected reunion in the Capitol yesterday! This is a truly touching story.
Enjoyed showing The New Orleans Advocate around the Capitol earlier today. Here's their story on how we work to bring Louisiana to Washington.
I'm grateful to President Trump for swiftly approving this declaration. It means a lot to Louisiana families working to rebuild and recover after this week's severe tornadoes.

Obamacare is continuing to collapse. This failed law is hurting Americans -- taking away choices and making healthcare unaffordable and inaccessible. We are working to repeal and replace Obamacare to provide Americans with relief and put them back in control of their healthcare decisions.

I was honored to join our House leadership team in welcoming Prime Minister Netanyahu to Congress today. As our closest and most trusted ally in the Middle East, I made it clear to the Prime Minister that the Jewish state of Israel can count on the full support of Congress, and I look forward to building on our long-lasting strategic partnership. Ì†ºÌ∑∫Ì†ºÌ∑∏ Ì†ºÌ∑ÆÌ†ºÌ∑±
Last week we saw tornadoes rip through south Louisiana, causing severe damage to homes and businesses. We are focused on making sure those affected have the support they need to rebuild and recover.
Today we honor George Washington ‚Äî our nation's first President ‚Äî and all who have served our nation as President. Happy Presidents' Day!

We are a nation of immigrants and a nation of laws. So-called ‚Äòsanctuary city‚Äô policies not only represent a direct affront to the rule of law, they create dangerous gaps in our criminal justice system that put Americans at risk.

Under Obamacare, families across Louisiana are facing lost coverage and double-digit premium increases. The most important goal should be making sure hardworking Americans can afford quality health insurance.
Antisemitism and violent threats have absolutely no place in our society, and must be confronted.

The NASA Michoud facility is a critical asset to southeast Louisiana, employing over 3,000 people and housing tenants such as the USDA National Finance Center on its campus here in New Orleans. Today I sat down with leadership from both NASA and the USDA to discuss this month's tornado damage and recovery plans for the facility. I'm committed to working alongside my colleagues in Louisiana‚Äôs Congressional delegation to ensure that the families and communities affected by the tornado destruction have the support they need to rebuild and recover.
Shouting down a military veteran who is leading the Pledge of Allegiance and a minister leading the prayer? That's just wrong.
The Krewe of Muses is rolling through the streets of New Orleans #MardiGras2017

Join me at 9:30 AM CT this morning for a town hall meeting by dialing 1-877-229-8493 and entering the code 14566 when prompted. Agree or disagree, I look forward to hearing your comments and answering your questions.

Thanks to everyone who participated in our town hall this morning and asked a question. We dialed out to more than 59,750 households in our district, and 3,745 of you participated in the event. I'm grateful for your feedback and I'm looking forward to doing this again soon.   Have a question we couldn't get to today? Please contact any of my offices in the First District or in Washington, DC (phone numbers are available at: http://scalise.house.gov).

I've heard from Louisiana families who lost healthcare plans they had and liked due to the broken promises of Obamacare. Now, I‚Äôd like to hear from you. Please click https://scaliseforms.house.gov/forms/form/?ID=3289 to share your story with me.
Human trafficking affects millions of victims who need our help. Working with President Trump, we will fight this epidemic together.
Nothing like watching Mardi Gras parades with my family!
While Democrats preferred to govern through backroom deals, Republicans are doing it right: building a consensus and working through the legislative process.
I enjoyed hosting Michael J. Fox today for a bipartisan meeting with House colleagues to share the great work he and his foundation do for patients with Parkinson‚Äôs disease.

At our meeting today, I presented Michael J. Fox with a copy of the 21st Century Cures Act signed by President Obama. This bipartisan bill was passed last Congress, and includes much-needed reforms to bring life-saving drugs to market faster and spur innovation that will lead to cures for millions of Americans.

In his address to Congress, President Trump laid out an optimistic vision for America and a plan to get the country back on track. This plan includes working with Congress to create jobs, get rid of red-tape, strengthen our national security and repeal and replace Obamacare.

Congratulations to my friend and former House colleague Ryan Zinke on being confirmed as our next Secretary of the Interior. Ryan is an American hero who served our country with distinction as a Navy SEAL, and he will continue to serve us well in this important new role.  Not only is Ryan a strong proponent of responsibly developing America‚Äôs vast energy resources, he also understands that producing energy and protecting the environment are not mutually exclusive. I was glad to host him on my annual Offshore Energy Tour in 2015, when we traveled to a production platform in the Gulf of Mexico to see firsthand how American oil and gas are safely developed, and also discussed the importance of revenue sharing so Louisiana can restore our coast while strengthening America's energy security.

Last night, President Trump laid out a vision for renewing America's strength and national unity. He made it clear that he intends to stand up for our country and keep his promises to the American people.

We had a great meeting with President Donald J. Trump today about repealing and replacing Obamacare to make quality healthcare more affordable and accessible for hardworking families in Louisiana and throughout the nation.
Obamacare is a failed experiment that has led to higher costs for Americans. With our approach, you can choose the healthcare options that work best for you and your family.

Here's a photo from earlier this week, just before we escorted President Trump into the House chamber for his address to a joint session of Congress. What did you think of the President's speech and his vision for our country?

Obamacare's days are numbered. Republicans are following through on the promise we made to repeal and replace this failed law.  Working with President Trump and Vice President Pence, we are working to replace Obamacare with a plan that puts patients in the driver's seat and makes quality healthcare more affordable and accessible for American families.
We are getting ready to repeal and replace Obamacare. Read more here --->

Today Chairman Sean Duffy and I hosted a roundtable discussion with several parish presidents to discuss the reauthorization of the NFIP. As we work to make this program even better, I'm dedicated to ensuring flood insurance remains affordable for every family.

Today‚Äôs action by the Trump Administration opens the Gulf of Mexico to more responsible energy exploration, as well as the resulting bonuses, lease payments, and royalties generated, which will help communities through job growth and funding towards Louisiana's coastal restoration plan.

Republicans are following through on our promise to repeal Obamacare and replace it with healthcare reforms that make quality care more affordable and accessible. Read the bill and find out more at http://ReadTheBill.gop
Want to know more about our bill to repeal and replace Obamacare? Check out this op-ed by my colleagues Kevin Brady and Greg Walden. And read the full bill at http://ReadTheBill.gop

I'll be heading to the White House later today to meet with President Trump about repealing and replacing Obamacare. Below is what HHS Secretary Tom Price said today on behalf of the Trump Administration in endorsing our plan. Read the full bill at http://ReadTheBill.gop!
For House Republicans, rescuing the American people from the failures of Obamacare is our #1 priority.

Since its implementation, House Republicans have seen the devastation Obamacare has caused families. From sky-high premiums, doctors leaving the practice of healthcare, insurance companies withdrawing from the healthcare marketplace and hospital closures, it‚Äôs beyond time to repeal and replace this bill with reforms that actually work. Read our plan at ReadTheBill.gop

Today we start the process of repealing and replacing President Obama's disastrous healthcare law here, in the same room where it began. Our American Health Care Act provides fiscally responsible legislation to deliver relief from Obamacare's taxes and skyrocketing premiums, preserve vital patient protections and advance 21st century reforms to help Americans access affordable, quality healthcare.

Here's a real story from one of my constituents about how Obamacare doesn't work for their family. Unelected bureaucrats shouldn‚Äôt have the power to tell the American people what kind of healthcare coverage works best for their families.  Have an Obamacare story to share? Click below to share your story with me.

We are here today because Obamacare has failed.  For hardworking American families, Obamacare means struggling with skyrocketing costs, losing the plans they had and liked, and having fewer choices. Our American Health Care Act repeals Obamacare once and for all, and replaces it with patient-centered reforms that finally make quality health care more affordable and accessible.
In 2016, Republicans made a promise to repeal President Obama's failed health care law and replace it with reforms that actually work.   We're keeping our promises to the American people.
I won't be stopped from sharing the stories of the people I represent who have been hurt by Obamacare. It's time to repeal and replace this failed law.

Unelected bureaucrats shouldn‚Äôt have the ability to tell families what kind of healthcare they have to buy. Instead, I‚Äôm fighting to give families the freedom to choose the healthcare plan that works best for them.

Let‚Äôs be clear‚Äîthere‚Äôs a big difference between having an insurance card and having access to quality healthcare. Our plan bridges that divide and makes it easier for families to choose the plan that works best for them.
This bill eviscerates Obamacare.
Repealing and Replacing Obamacare is a 3-step process. Step 1: Reconciliation Step 2: Administrative action Step 3: Additional legislation
We need to fix Medicaid, the most broken part of our healthcare system, and governors in the states know best how to do it. Our plan allows states to make Medicaid work best for their citizens.
Repealing Obamacare and replacing it with our patient-centered reforms: ‚úîÔ∏èLowers premiums ‚úîÔ∏èCuts taxes ‚úîÔ∏èReduces the deficit
Instead of forcing families to pay high prices for healthcare, we're bringing back competition and real choices to lower costs for Americans.
For hardworking American families, Obamacare means struggling with skyrocketing costs, losing plans they had and liked, and having fewer choices. #ObamacareRealStories

Letting Obamacare continue its death spiral would be irresponsible. Republicans committed to the American people that we would rescue them from Obamacare, and that's exactly what the American Health Care Act does.

It is exciting to work side-by-side with Vice President Mike Pence, a great friend and former House colleague. Under President Trump's leadership, our unified Republican government is working hand-in-hand to repeal and replace Obamacare, provide tax relief for families, roll back Washington red tape, grow our economy, create jobs, strengthen our national security, and make life better for every American.

I had a great meeting at the White House with President Trump and fellow House conservatives today about repealing and replacing Obamacare. There was full agreement on how to proceed with our bill to give Americans a greater choice of affordable, accessible health care. Throughout this process, President Trump has been directly engaged with members of Congress to bring the best ideas forward, and that‚Äôs what today‚Äôs meeting was all about.
Had a great meeting yesterday to discuss critical coastline restoration projects in Louisiana with Rep. Garret Graves and King Milling, Chairman of the America's Wetland Foundation.
Great to join WWL-TV Channel 4 this morning to talk about my meeting with the President and how we‚Äôre working together to repeal and replace Obamacare.
President Trump has an important message for my daughter Madison on her 10th birthday!

I‚Äôm committed to keeping my promise to rescue Louisiana families from the failures of Obamacare, and that's exactly what the American Health Care Act does. I am proud to work closely with my colleagues and President Trump to pass this important legislation so he can sign it into law.
Earlier this week, the Congressional Budget Office released their report on the American Health Care Act. Here's what they found about how this bill will help you and your family:
Today I celebrate 12 wonderful years of marriage with my best friend and mother of our 2 great kids. Happy anniversary, Jennifer!

For hardworking families, the last seven years under Obamacare have meant struggling with skyrocketing costs, losing plans they had and liked, and having fewer choices. Our American Health Care Act is a critical step to making quality, affordable care accessible for all Americans.
I had a great meeting today with Waterways Council to discuss infrastructure projects in Louisiana's ports and waterways.
We are leading a rescue mission to finally let families be in charge of their healthcare decisions again.

Repealing/replacing Obamacare is a promise both President Trump and Republican members of Congress made to the American people. This Thursday, we're passing the American Health Care Act to keep that promise.

I continue to have meetings with people in Southeast Louisiana who are concerned about the future of the National Flood Insurance Program (NFIP). The NFIP is set to expire at the end of September and I am working hard to keep it accessible and affordable for people in Louisiana. If you have thoughts or opinions about the program or have general concerns about it, please reach out to my office at 202-225-3015.

Yesterday‚Äôs oil and gas lease sale in the Gulf of Mexico shows significant growth over last year and reflects the energy industry‚Äôs confidence in future Gulf projects. This is a big step forward for the hardworking people of Louisiana‚Äôs energy industry, and I‚Äôll continue working alongside the Trump Administration to cut harmful regulation and encourage energy independence.

I am thrilled that after years of the Obama administration unnecessarily blocking the construction of the Keystone XL pipeline, today President Donald J. Trump delivered on his promise to approve its construction once and for all. This is a great deal for America, creating thousands of jobs and helping to unleash our energy independence.
Harrison was a great navigator on our Cub Scout canoeing trip this weekend!

I had the opportunity to meet with Captain Luis Avila, an army captain originally from Metairie who served five combat tours in both Afghanistan and Iraq. Captain Avila, thank you for the service and the sacrifices you have made for this country. It was an honor to meet you in my office today!

Many of the energy regulations enacted under the Obama administration were just Washington power grabs. They imposed costly and burdensome regulations on our energy industry that killed jobs in coal country and raised energy costs on American consumers.   Thankfully, President Trump‚Äôs reversal of these misguided rules yesterday will give Louisiana energy producers the ability to grow and hire again, putting us on the path to energy independence with affordable prices for all Americans.

Today I met with the Louisiana Restaurant Association in my D.C. office. The meeting covered key topics important to our state's restaurant industry, which employs over 160,000 hard-working Louisianians and brings in billions of dollars in revenue for our state.
We're going to keep working. Obamacare continues to fail the American people. We're more resolved than ever to repeal this law.
Great to meet with Condoleezza Rice today to discuss foreign policy.
Honored to receive the American Association of Port Authorities "Port Person of the Year" award. Our ports are vital to many industries in our economy.
I spent some time yesterday with my friends Hannah and Craig. I'm proud to work alongside them to advocate for those with Down Syndrome.
Congratulations to the newest Supreme Court Justice, Neil Gorsuch! I commend President Donald J. Trump for nominating a principled conservative to our highest court.
From my family to yours, happy Easter!
Happy Easter to you and your family!

This #TaxDay, we're reminded of the pressing need to fix our broken tax code and make it simpler for all Americans to do their taxes. Our unified, Republican government is focused on passing reforms that create jobs, help small businesses, and put money back in your wallet!
Last week, I led a bipartisan congressional delegation to meet with military leaders stationed at US Army Garrison Italy. Thank you for your service! Ì†ºÌ∑∫Ì†ºÌ∑∏
Louisiana is home to some of the most culturally rich historical sites in the country! #FindYourPark
Spicy good eating at the Old Metairie Crawfish Festival!

President Trump has shown his commitment to American families with policies aimed at putting people back to work and growing our economy. His order today to promote American energy is another example of that dedication.
We have accomplished a lot during President Donald J. Trump's #First100Days in office ‚Äì I'm looking forward to working together in the next 100 days and beyond.
It's #SmallBusinessWeek ‚Äì we're working to ease regulations on small businesses so they can create good-paying jobs.

Yesterday, Secretary Ryan Zinke ordered a review of regulations pertaining to offshore oil & gas exploration. I‚Äôm encouraged that the administration is working with local leaders to strengthen our domestic energy production.

Had a great meeting yesterday with Louisiana members of the Associated General Contractors! We discussed how to get our economy going again and the importance of rolling back unnecessary federal regulations to create more Louisiana jobs.
President Donald J. Trump, Speaker Paul Ryan, and our entire leadership team are focused on passing a health care bill to provide much-needed relief from Obamacare.  via Fox News & America's Newsroom
Passage of the government funding bill is a win for conservative policies.
Share if you agree ‚Üí it's time to repeal and replace #Obamacare.

This bill rescues the American people from a law that has failed dismally. By passing the American Health Care Act, the House will end the skyrocketing premium increases, lower costs, and put patients back in charge of their health care decisions.
The House just voted to repeal and replace Obamacare.
The American Health Care Act provides much-needed relief from seven years of Obamacare.
Today, the American people saw their government listen to their voices and act on their priorities, and I am glad to tell them that the days of Obamacare will soon be over.
Passing the American Health Care Act was about saving families who are struggling under the weight of a broken law that doesn‚Äôt work.
Join me at 2:30 PM CT this afternoon for a town hall meeting by dialing 1-877-229-8493 and entering the code 14566 when prompted. I look forward to hearing your comments and answering your questions.
I'm looking forward to working with the Senate to get this health care bill to President Donald J. Trump's desk.
Obamacare is failing the American people. We promised to get rid of this law, now we're delivering on that promise.
Behind the scenes: Reince Priebus meets with House Republicans moments before historic vote to repeal and replace Obamacare.
We put together a bill that lowers premiums, protects people with pre-existing conditions, and lets people make their own health care decisions.
I'm looking forward to working with the Senate to repeal and replace Obamacare.   via Fox News & Maria Bartiromo
Many on the left argue the American Health Care Act will not cover patients with pre-existing conditions ‚Äì a claim that is simply not true.
Harrison "crossed over" from a wolf to a bear! #CubScouts
Happy Mother's Day to my wonderful wife and the best mom to our two great kids. Love you, Jennifer!
Off-shore energy is critical to our economy and our nation's energy security. That's why I hosted a bipartisan group of colleagues to show them first-hand the importance of this industry.

Today we're re-introducing the Steve Gleason Act to ensure that patients can continue to benefit from this life-changing legislation, and so that people with disabilities have greater opportunities when seeking treatments, cures, and independence. Team Gleason
Thankful for our law enforcement officers who keep our communities safe. #PoliceWeek

We're partnering with Team Gleason to make sure that folks suffering from ALS and other diseases have access to speech-generating devices. This measure literally gives a voice to those who need it most. #NoWhiteFlags  via WVUE FOX 8 News
This #PoliceWeek, we honor our men and women in blue -  especially those who have sacrificed their lives in the line of duty.
Last night, I joined March of Dimes to benefit a great cause, and took home the award for best hometown food.
Democrats have made plenty of false or misleading claims about health care. Here are just a few: http://bit.ly/2q2FFA0   via House Committee on Energy and Commerce
Human trafficking is a growing problem that affects each community right here in America.   We are working together to take strong action to protect victims and to bring child predators to justice.
While we can never fully repay the brave men and women who gave their lives for our freedom, we can honor their memory each and every day.
Honoring our fallen heroes
Praying for the victims of the terrorist attack in Kabul.

Today marks the beginning of #HurricaneSeason17. Being prepared is the best thing that you can do to protect your family, and taking simple steps can make a huge difference when faced with a disaster.  Visit my website to learn more information on storm preparation, evacuation tips, and more.
The Financial CHOICE Act: ‚úÖ Holds Wall Street accountable. ‚úÖ Unleashes opportunity for small businesses. ‚úÖ Provides regulatory relief. ‚úÖ Ends bailouts.

‚Ä™Today, Americans are grieving with the people of London and keeping the victims and their loved ones in our prayers. We stand with our friends and allies in the U.K. against this unspeakable evil. Together, we must combat and defeat radical Islamic terrorism.

We are hard at work tackling issues that matter to the American people ‚Üí I sat down with Washington Examiner to discuss topics ranging from repealing and replacing Obamacare, to tax reform, to balancing the budget.
We must do all we can to protect our communities for the long term through robust efforts to rebuild our eroding coastline.   Via NOLA.com

Soldiers, Sailors, and Airmen of the Allied Expeditionary Force!  You are about to embark upon the Great Crusade, toward which we have striven these many months. The eyes of the world are upon you.  The hopes and prayers of liberty-loving people everywhere march with you. In company with our brave Allies and brothers-in-arms on other Fronts, you will bring about the destruction of the German war machine, the elimination of Nazi tyranny over oppressed peoples of Europe, and security for ourselves in a free world.  Your task will not be an easy one.  Your enemy is well trained, well equipped, and battle-hardened.  He will fight savagely.  But this is the year 1944!  Much has happened since the Nazi triumphs of 1940-41.  The United Nations have inflicted upon the Germans great defeats, in open battle, man-to-man.  Our air offensive has seriously reduced their strength in the air and their capacity to wage war on the ground.  Our Home Fronts have given us an overwhelming superiority in weapons and munitions of war, and placed at our disposal great reserves of trained fighting men.  The tide has turned!  The free men of the world are marching together to victory!  I have full confidence in your courage, devotion to duty and skill in battle.  We will accept nothing less than full victory!  Good Luck!  And let us all beseech the blessing of Almighty God upon this great and noble undertaking.  - General Dwight D. Eisenhower

The amphibious Higgins Boat ‚Äì a product of New Orleans ‚Äì was instrumental in the success of #DDay. Pictured here, troops travel to shore aboard a landing craft, vehicle personnel (LCVP) vessel during the Normandy Invasion.   The courage and grit of our armed forces, paired with the ingenuity of the American people won us the war and liberated millions from tyranny.
No. More. Bailouts.   This week, House Republicans will dismantle Dodd-Frank.   Via National Review
I joined Fox News to discuss the need to #RepealAndReplace #Obamacare. This failed law continues to hurt hard-working American families.
America is exporting oil at twice the rate we did in 2016! I am proud to have led the fight to lift the crude oil export ban so we can export energy produced right here in the USA Ì†ºÌ∑∫Ì†ºÌ∑∏
The House passed the Financial CHOICE Act, making it easier to get a mortgage, and getting Washington out of your way.   via Fox Business & Varney & Co.

Dodd-Frank is crushing community banks and hurting small businesses and families. Last week the House passed the Financial CHOICE Act to do away with this failed law and bring opportunity back to Main Street.
Congrats to LSU Baseball on a hard-earned win ‚Äì we are cheering you on as you head to Omaha for the NCAA Baseball College World Series!
We just passed a bill to hold the VA accountable so our veterans can get the care they deserve.

Update on the Condition of Majority Whip Steve Scalise:   This morning, at a practice for the Congressional Baseball Game, Whip Scalise was shot in the hip. He was transported to MedStar Washington Hospital Center, where he is currently undergoing surgery. He is in stable condition.  Prior to entering surgery, the Whip was in good spirits and spoke to his wife by phone. He is grateful for the brave actions of U.S. Capitol Police, first responders, and colleagues.   We ask that you keep the Whip and others harmed in this incident in your thoughts and prayers.  This office will release additional information regarding the Whip's condition as appropriate.

Update on the condition of Majority Whip Steve Scalise, courtesy of MedStar Washington Hospital Center:  "Rep. Scalise was critically injured and remains in critical condition. The other patient is in good condition."

Update on the condition of Majority Whip Steve Scalise, courtesy of MedStar Washington Hospital Center:  Congressman Steve Scalise sustained a single rifle shot to the left hip. The bullet travelled across his pelvis, fracturing bones, injuring internal organs, and causing severe bleeding. He was transported in shock to MedStar Washington Hospital Center, a Level I Trauma Center. He underwent immediate surgery, and an additional procedure to stop bleeding. He has received multiple units of blood transfusion. His condition is critical, and he will require additional operations. We will provide periodic updates.

Condition Update on Congressman Steve Scalise, courtesy of MedStar Washington Hospital Center:  Earlier today, Congressman Steve Scalise underwent a second surgery related to his internal injuries and a broken bone in his leg. He remains in critical condition, but has improved in the last 24 hours. The Congressman will require additional operations, and will be in the hospital for some time. At the request of the family, we will continue to provide periodic updates.

Statement from Jennifer Scalise:   On behalf of Steve and our children, I want to thank everyone from the bottom of our hearts for the incredible amount of prayers and warm wishes we have received since Wednesday's events.   We are especially appreciative of the strong outpouring of love and support from our neighbors, friends, from Louisiana and across the country, as well as from President Trump, Vice President Pence, and all of Steve's colleagues who have reached out to us during this most challenging time.   Most importantly, we are forever grateful for the heroism of Special Agents Crystal Griner and David Bailey, who saved the lives of everyone at the baseball field that morning, including Steve's. Crystal and David have been family to us for years, and we ask that you continue to pray for their full recovery.   I would also like to personally thank all of the first responders who bravely assisted at the scene, as well as the entire staff of MedStar Washington Hospital Center for their continued excellent care.   Our family asks that you continue to pray for Steve, Matt Mika, Zach Barth, and all of those hurt in this attack, and keep them in your thoughts as they face recovery.
Condition update for Majority Whip Steve Scalise: https://www.majoritywhip.gov/news/condition-update-congressman-steve-scalise/

Update on the condition of Majority Whip Steve Scalise, courtesy of MedStar Washington Hospital Center:   Congressman Steve Scalise is in serious condition. He underwent another surgery today, but continues to show signs of improvement.  He is more responsive, and is speaking with his loved ones. The Scalise family greatly appreciates the outpouring of thoughts and prayers.   Note: This is the final update for the weekend.

The Medal of Valor is the highest national award a public safety officer can receive, and is given to those who have exhibited exceptional courage, regardless of personal safety, to save or protect human life. I cannot think of a group of individuals more deserving of this award than Special Agents David Bailey, Crystal Griner, and Officers Nicole Battaglia, Kevin Jobe, and Alexander Jensen.  Most people instinctively run from danger, but these officers did not hesitate to put their own lives on the line to run towards it that morning of June 14 to protect the lives of others. David, Crystal, Nicole, Kevin, and Alexander all have families of their own, yet they courageously confronted and stopped the shooter.  I am thankful to President Donald J. Trump for recognizing their heroism with this highest honor, and am grateful to all of the men and women in law enforcement who risk their lives to preserve our safety each and every day.
These officers didn't hesitate to put their own lives on the line to protect the lives of others. They are my heroes.

I'm disgusted by the violence and killing that took place in Charlottesville, and by the vile white supremacist bigotry that inspired it. There must be no tolerance for racism in our nation, and we must work together as Americans and human beings to defeat white supremacy and all forms of hatred. My prayers are with the loved ones of Heather Heyer, Lt. H. Jay Cullen, and Trooper-Pilot Berke M.M. Bates who tragically died as a result of this evil. May they rest in peace.

If you need a reminder of what a hero looks like, watch David Bailey address students at his alma mater, North Carolina Central University. David Bailey and Crystal Griner have been part of our family for years, and they are my heroes.

Today I join Americans everywhere in honoring the thousands of innocent lives that were lost 16 years ago when radical Islamic terrorists perpetrated attacks of unimaginable evil against our country. While we can never forget the anger and anguish we felt, we also will never forget the awe we felt in watching our first responders risk their lives to save others, and the everyday Americans across the country who stepped up in the aftermath to help, including thousands who were inspired to answer the call to duty and join our military.  Through all of the destruction, the American spirit was never broken, and our resolve proved it never could be. Though our country continues to face serious threats both at home and abroad, we will never surrender our American ideals and way of life. Let us all reflect today on how blessed we are to live in the greatest country in the history of the world, and continue to pray for those we lost, as well as those in our military who sacrificed in order to serve and who continue protecting our freedoms.

Across the nation each December, families and friends gather to celebrate each other and all that God has blessed us with. This Christmas especially, we have so much to be grateful for.   This holiday season, I encourage everyone to pause and reflect on the service and sacrifice of the brave men and women who give so much to our country every single day. From our soldiers spending their holidays overseas, to the first responders, firefighters, and law enforcement officers here at home, these individuals have earned the thankfulness of all Americans for the sacrifices they have made and the freedoms they have defended for us. Throughout this season of celebration, may we pause to reflect on the sacrifices they are making for our country. We owe them a never-ending debt of gratitude.   This year brought forth many challenges for me and my family, and we will always remember and deeply appreciate the many prayers, kind words, and well wishes given to us during those hard times. You have no idea how much that meant to us.   I am incredibly grateful for the privilege of representing the people of Louisiana. From my family to yours, we wish you a Merry Christmas. May God continue to bless you, and may God continue to bless the United States of America.
Wonderful to spend Christmas at home with my family. Wishing you and your loved ones a very Merry Christmas!

Tax cuts are working! This week, SunTrust announced it is increasing wages for its employees, giving cash bonuses, and increasing retirement contributions.   Dozens more companies are taking action as a result of the Tax Cuts and Jobs Act:

Family-owned ShopRite announced bonuses for 1,000 employees after the passage of our tax bill.  As their CEO said, "Our ability to provide bonuses and training to our employees demonstrates the far-reaching implications of this tax reform. We have a renewed optimism for the local and the national economy, and this important legislation better positions us for future growth.‚Äù  Along with their sales director: ‚ÄúThis legislation benefits those of who count on Main Street budgets for our livelihoods, and it‚Äôs a privilege to share the benefits with the men and women who work so hard at ShopRite. It makes it possible to succeed in a very competitive industry.‚Äù  Tax reform works.
